title: Models
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
dmg <- read_csv("matchmaking_data/CS_Damage.csv")
weapon_damage_summary <- dmg |> 
  group_by(wp) |> 
  summarize(
    total_hp_damage = sum(hp_dmg, na.rm = TRUE),
    average_hp_damage = mean(hp_dmg, na.rm = TRUE),
    count = n()
  ) |>
  arrange(desc(total_hp_damage))

weapon_damage_summary

# A tibble: 41 × 4
   wp     total_hp_damage average_hp_damage  count
   <chr>            <dbl>             <dbl>  <int>

 2 M4A4           3877496              25.9 149541
 3 AWP            3387311              81.9  41378

 5 USP            1436347              31.4  45695
 6 Glock          1148509              26.4  43462
 7 M4A1            996480              26.5  37623
 8 CZ              940885              26.3  35719
 9 HE              896832              19.3  46442
10 P250            732527              29.6  24711

kills <- read_csv("matchmaking_data/CS_Kills.csv")

title: Models
section: splitting the data into kills per weapon,
text: splitting the data into kills per weapon,

title: Models
section: one kill occurs each row of the dataset, so the kills represent the number of rows
text:
one kill occurs each row of the dataset, so the kills represent the number of rows

kills_detailed <- kills |>
  group_by(wp) |>  
  summarize(kills = n(),
            average_kills = mean(kills)
            ) |>
  arrange(desc(kills))
kills_detailed
